alert.note: Alert for Garvin; Murray; Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 11 at 4:13AM CDT until July 11 at 9:15AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Pontotoc County in east central Oklahoma... East Central Garvin County in southern Oklahoma... Eastern Murray County in southern Oklahoma... * Until 915 AM CDT. * At 413 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ada, Sulphur, Davis, Roff, Fitzhugh, Dougherty, Hickory, Scullin, Vanoss, Lake Of The Arbuckles and Turner Falls. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at pre dawn when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
